Context:
Program Name: Business Administration – Marketing
Code: B108
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Duration: 3 years (6 semesters)
Method of Study: Full-time
Starting Months: January, September
Locations: St. James Campus
Experiential Learning: Field Education Course (Optional)
Program Delivery: On campus for all semesters
Domestic Tuition: $4,531.00 *
International Tuition: $17,455.00 **
Program Description: Hands-on and project-based learning with opportunities for case studies and real-world projects involving industry partners. Includes advanced marketing courses such as digital marketing, international marketing, marketing research, and marketing strategy.
Additional Information: Opportunities for business electives to expand horizons.

* Domestic tuition may vary depending on the semester and specific program requirements.
** International tuition is subject to change based on immigration status and other factors.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Business Administration – Marketing Program B108 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The George Brown College offers marketing courses that include research, strategy, international marketing, digital marketing, and the development of soft skills. Students will learn to develop marketing communication strategies, conduct market research, establish effective working relationships, evaluate marketing products in international markets, and formulate marketing plans. The college also integrates digital marketing and social media into marketing plans. Industry partners align curriculum to industry needs, provide hands-on learning through class projects, and offer field education opportunities. Students can participate in extracurricular activities such as Ontario Colleges Marketing Competition, Vanier BDC Case Challenge, Enactus George Brown, speed mentoring events, Great Canadian Sales Competition, and Ad Week. The Centre for Business programs at George Brown College have earned international recognition from the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP). The college has 14 accredited diploma, advanced diploma, and degree programs in Accounting & Finance, HR, Management, and Marketing. Two colleges in Ontario have earned ACBSP accreditation.

Program Key Performance Indicators:
- Program: B108
- Graduate Employment (%): 70 (2020-21), 92 (2019-20)
- Graduate Satisfaction (%): 69 (2020-21), 70 (2019-20)

George Brown College has adopted a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) initiative.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Business Administration – Marketing Program B108 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
* Centre for Business students are required to bring their own laptops for the Device (BYOD) initiative.
* Open access computers and equipment borrowing on a short-term basis are available at the Library Learning Commons.
* Contact information for the Centre for Business: business@georgebrown.ca
* Students have the option of earning a business elective credit with Field Education Course (BUS 1067).
* Students participate in client projects during their course work, adding to experiential learning outcomes.
* Application for "Business Administration – Marketing with Work Experience" should apply to B158.
* George Brown Marketing students have access to membership of Canadian Marketing Association (CMA) and Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB).
* Included benefits for CMA membership: live and online events, professional development opportunities, tools, resources, networking opportunities, exclusive access to CMA NXT.
* Included benefits for IAB membership: student volunteer opportunities, members only webinars and podcasts, original Canadian digital marketing research, globally accepted digital ad standards, globally standardized courses, certification, and custom workshops.
* Graduates from the Business Administration – Marketing program are prepared for careers in various business sectors like advertising agencies, marketing consulting firms, telecommunication and media, digital marketing, retailers, banks and financial institutions, government, not-for-profit and small businesses.
* Career options for graduates: account manager, digital marketing coordinator, brand coordinator, digital brand ambassador, sales associate, customer service representative, financial service representative.
* Students need to complete 38 courses (30 mandatory + 5 Business) to graduate from the B108 program.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Business Administration – Marketing Program B108 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
To graduate from the college, a student needs to complete 38 courses in total. Out of these, 30 are mandatory courses, 5 are Business Electives, and 3 are General Education Electives. Students may be required to take additional courses such as COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) and MATH 1027 (Business Math with Remediation), depending on the results of their placement tests. These extra courses do not count toward the 38 courses required for graduation and will be charged for separately.

General Education Courses need to be completed in semesters 2, 3, and 4. Students must complete three General Education courses chosen from at least two categories: Social Sciences (GSSC), Arts and Humanities (GHUM), or Science and Technology (GSCI). Students are required to make up any failed or dropped courses before they are eligible to graduate. These courses can be made up during the day, and some are offered in the evening through Continuing Education. Students must check with the business office staff to ensure that the Continuing Education courses are equivalent to what is taught in the full-time program. Some courses may not be offered in every semester.

The following is a list of courses for Semesters 1 and 2:

Semester 1:
- BUS 1038: Business Concepts I (None)
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts (None)
- COMP 1010: Business Computer Applications I (None)
- MARK 1020: Principles of Marketing I (None)
- MATH 1008: Math for Business & Management (None)
- MARK 1046: Marketing Today (None)

Semester 2:
- ACCT 1036: Principles of Accounting (None)
- COMM 1034: Professional Communication (COMM 2000)
- COMP 1115: Business Computer Applications II (COMP 1010)
- MARK 2049: Principles of Marketing II (MARK 1020 & MARK 1046)
- MATH 1131: Mathematical Analysis for Marketers (MATH 1008)
- CMMK 1087: Human Skills (None)

Students are required to select one General Education Elective.

Context:
The text provides information about the course offerings and learning outcomes of a marketing program at the college. Here is the extracted information:

* Students must successfully complete semester 3 with a GPA of 3.0 to be considered for interview for some courses.
* Some courses require interview only (MARK 2053 - Negotiation Skills, MARK 1002 & by interview only - Advanced Selling Skills).
* The following marketing related courses are offered: MARK 2053, MARK 2028, MARK 1020, MARK 2061, MARK 2007, STAT 1012, MARK 3032, MARK 1020, MGMT 1034, MGMT 3013, MGMT 2037, and MGMT 2037.
* The program learning outcomes include the ability to develop a marketing plan, integrated marketing communication plan, determine strategies for product development and placement, analyze market viability, conduct market research, deliver sales presentations, maintain working relationships, enhance professional growth, identify entrepreneurial opportunities, apply organizational policies and practices, and apply business ethics and corporate social responsibility principles.
* Tuition for domestic students is $4,531.00 (*).

Note: The text mentions 'The Centre for Business office' but does not provide an email address or phone number for contact purposes.

Context:
Domestic Tuition: $4,531.00 for programs starting in Fall 2022
International Tuition: $17,455.00 for programs starting in Fall 2023
Additional costs are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and later dates.
Program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet eligibility criteria.
Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, grade 12 English (C or U), and either grade 11 math (C, M or U) or grade 12 (C or U). Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English and math, or consider upgrading.
Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions. Please visit the transfer guide for more information.
English proficiency is necessary for success in the program. Review English proficiency requirements.
Country-specific admission requirements can be found on the International Admissions page.
Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should refer to the How to Apply page for application details.

For advice on program options and which program might be best suited, make an appointment to see an Entry Advisor. The Business Administration Marketing program is offered out of the School of Marketing and classes take place at George Brown College. Contact Lori Futterer, Program Co-ordinator (Email: lfuttere@georgebrown.ca) or John Peco, Chair, School of Marketing (Email: john.peco@georgebrown.ca) for inquiries related to this program."
